questions.uddipok:
Christopher Columbus was an explorer. In 1492, he sailed from Europe to America. He and his sailors crossed the Atlantic Ocean, not knowing where they would land. It was a voyage into the unknown. After Columbus, other Europeans began to explore and settle in America. Christopher Columbus was born in 1451. It was a time of new ideas and discoveries in Europe. We call this time Renaissance - a word that means 'rebirth'. People were making maps of new lands. They were building ships to explore places Where they had never visited before. Columbus did not discover America. There were many people already living there. Viking from Europe had landed in America 500 years before. People in Europe-wanted to find a new sea route, to trade with Asia. They wanted to send ships to India, China and the East Indies. The Portuguese tried to sail to the South around Africa. It was a long way. Columbus wanted to sail west. Columbus hoped to reach China in a few days. He needed money to make his dream come true. Columbus tried to persuade rich people to help him. Most laughed at him. At last, King Ferdinand and Queen Isabella of Spain gave him money for ships.
Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: The text is about Christopher Columbus, a famous European explorer, and his voyage to America. Columbus was born in 1451, the time of Renaissance. He sailed from Europe to America in 1492. After his voyage, the Europeans found a new sea route 'and started to explore and settle in America. During the time of Columbus, the Europeans, the Portuguese and other nations were trying to explore places that had never been visited before. Columbus also wanted to sail west. Being short of money, he tried to persuade the rich people to help him in this regard but failed. Finally, King Ferdinand and Queen Isabella of Spain gave him money.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on 'A Book Fair':
(a) What is a book fair? (b) When and where is it held? (c) How popular is it? (d) Have you ever visitied a book fair? (e) What kind of books are usually available in a book fair?

sub_questions.explanation:
A Book Fair
A book fair is a kind of fair where different types of books are displayed for sale. Book fair is now held in every city and town too. It has recently become very popular in our country. People go to the fair to find their desired books. In Bangladesh, a book fair is arranged on the occasion of 21 s t 21^{st} 2 1 s t February, 16 th 16^{\text {th }} 1 6 th December, 26 th 26^{\text {th }} 2 6 th March and Bangla New Year. The fair is held in an open place or in auditorium or in a big hall-room. In our country, the largest book fair is held on the premises of Bangla Academy on the occasion of 21 t h 21^{th} 2 1 t h February. All kinds of books such as fiction, drama, poetry, novel, biography, translation, children literature, story books, etc. are usually available in a book fair. A book fair usually remains crowded. People from all walks of life visit the fair. People who are book lovers come to the fair to buy books and to enjoy the fair. Young boys and girls gather here to find out books of their favourite authors. They buy books to present them as gifts to their near and dear ones and for themselves. From the interest and participation of people, the popularity of book fair in our country can be realised. A book fair bears great importance. Moreover, it creates a sense of interest for books among the general people. It is really an exceptional place. It develops and flourishes our reading habits and thus makes us enlightened. It also helps develop our creativity.

The Greatness of Gias Uddin Azam Shah
Gias Uddin Azam Shah was a great ruler of Bengal. He was very kind and just. He was fond of hunting. One day, he went a hunting at a nearby jungle. He aimed at a fawn but his arrow missed its target and pierced into the chest of a young boy who died
instantly. The boy was the son of a widow. She went to the Quazi and complained against the Sultan for justice. The Quazi called for the Sultan and said, "According to the law, of the country, you shall be punished. But if you can please the widow by giving her compensation for the loss, you may get rid of the due punishment." The Sultan gladly did it and the widow. was satisfied. Then the Quazi got down from his seat and showed the Sultan due respect.
The kind Sultan then drew out his sword and said, "Listen to me, Mr Quazi, if you had failed to do justice to the widow, I would have cut off your head with this sword." The Quazi also drew out his cane and said, "If you had disobeyed my justice, I would have beaten you with this cane." The Sultan thanked the Quazi for his brave and true judgement and embraced him.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Meem, living at DIT plot Gandaria, Dhaka: Now, write a letter to your younger brother describing the importance of games and sports.

sub_questions.explanation:
DIT Plot, Gandaria Dhaka January 11, 2025
Dear Brother,
I hope you are doing well and making the most of your time. Today, I want to share something very important with you—the role games and sports play in our lives.
You must remember that "a healthy mind resides in a healthy body." Games and sports are not just about fun; they are essential for physical and mental well-being. They keep our bodies strong and flexible, improve blood circulation, and strengthen immunity. Participating in sports also sharpens the mind by developing concentration, discipline, and decision-making skills.
Besides, games and sports teach us teamwork, leadership, and how to handle both victory and defeat gracefully. These qualities are crucial in life, not just on the field. Engaging in sports also helps relieve stress and refreshes the mind, enabling us to study or work better.
So, don’t spend all your time indoors with books or gadgets. Go out, play cricket, football, or whatever you like—it will make you healthier and happier.
Take this advice seriously, as it will make a big difference in your life. I’d love to hear about your favorite sport and how you are practicing it. Write to me soon!
With love, Meem

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Rasin. You have a friend Nobojit. He lives in a village. Now, write a dialogue between you and your friend on the merits and demerits of village life and city life.

sub_questions.explanation:
Ritu : Hello, Situ! Nice to see you here. How are you?
Situ : I'm fine, thanks. What about you?
Ritu : I'm ok. I think it would be better if you got yourself admitted into a college in the city as I did.
Situ : I don't think so, Ritu. Actually, I don't like cities.
Ritu : Why? What're the things of city life you dislike?
Situ : I think, life in the city is very artificial. People lead a very busy life there. They get up in the morning hearing the noises of motor vehicles, machines and factories.
Ritu : You're right. But there are many modern facilities that you can have only in cities. Good educational institutes, hospitals and clinics are mainly available in the city. Again, there are many spots for recreations.
Situ: : That's true. But I think life in the village is far better than that of the town. Village life is quite natural. People lead a very simple life. They wake up from sleep hearing the chirping of the birds and can breathe in fresh air: Do you have fresh fish in the town
Ritu : - Actually, fishes are available there, but not fresh.
Situ : But fresh food, fishes, vegetables, fruits etc. are available in the village, Moreover, village life is pollution free.
Ritu : You're right. But village life is not without its disadvantages. Disease, hunger, malnutrition and poverty are common in the life of the villagers. Also, jobs are not available here.
Situ : Hmm. Actually, both lives have their advantages and disadvantages. I think a balanced development can remove the gap between these two types of life.
Ritu : Yes. I agree with you. See you later.
Situ : Ok, bye. Take a good care of yourself.
